# Example: React + MUI + Gemini

This example demonstrates how `agents-config` sets up a project using:
- **React** (Vite)
- **Material-UI (MUI)** v7+
- **Google Gemini** AI integration

## Generated Files

After running `npx agents-init` and selecting Claude and Gemini:

```
my-react-app/
├── .agents/
│   ├── AGENTS.md
│   ├── rules/
│   │   ├── accessibility.md
│   │   ├── component-architecture.md
│   │   ├── spec-driven-development.md
│   │   ├── mui.md              # MUI-specific patterns
│   │   ├── gemini.md           # Gemini integration rules
│   │   └── web-performance.md
│   ├── skills/
│   │   ├── accessibility-audit/SKILL.md
│   │   ├── scaffold-component/SKILL.md
│   │   ├── integrate-gemini/SKILL.md  # Gemini workflow
│   │   └── vercel-react-best-practices/SKILL.md
│   └── instructions/
│       ├── development-standards.instructions.md
│       └── mui.instructions.md  # MUI theming guide
├── .agents-project.json
├── CLAUDE.md
└── .gemini/config.md
```

## .agents-project.json

```json
{
  "$schema": "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ericthayer/agents-config/main/schemas/agents-project.schema.json",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "project": {
    "name": "my-react-app",
    "framework": "react",
    "styling": "mui",
    "database": "none"
  },
  "agents": ["claude", "gemini"],
  "features": {
    "gemini": true,
    "storybook": false,
    "threejs": false
  },
  "rules": {
    "include": [
      "accessibility",
      "component-architecture",
      "spec-driven-development",
      "mui",
      "gemini",
      "web-performance"
    ],
    "exclude": []
  },
  "overrides": {}
}
```

## Gemini Integration Highlights

The `gemini.md` rule includes:

### Security Requirements
- Never expose API keys in client code
- Use server-side proxy for production
- Implement rate limiting

### UX Patterns
- Always use streaming for responses > 50 words
- Show loading indicators during generation
- Provide clear AI attribution

### Example from `.agents/rules/gemini.md`:

```tsx
// ✅ Good: Streaming for better UX
const result = await model.generateContentStream(prompt);
for await (const chunk of result.stream) {
  setText(prev => prev + chunk.text());
}

// ❌ Bad: Blocking until complete response
const result = await model.generateContent(prompt);
setText(result.response.text());
```

## MUI Integration Highlights

The `mui.md` rule and `mui.instructions.md` include:

### Theming
- Use CSS variables for theme tokens
- Support dark mode via `useColorScheme`
- Consistent spacing with theme.spacing()

### Accessibility
- All form fields must have labels
- Use semantic color roles
- Ensure focus indicators are visible

## Try It

```bash
# Create a new Vite React app
npm create vite@latest my-react-app -- --template react-ts

# Navigate and install
cd my-react-app
npm install @mui/material @emotion/react @emotion/styled
npm install @google/generative-ai
npm install agents-config --save-dev

# Initialize agent configuration
npx agents-init
# Select: Claude, Gemini
# Framework will auto-detect as React
# Styling will auto-detect as MUI
# Gemini: will auto-detect (or say yes)
```

## AI-Powered Features

With Gemini rules in place, your AI assistants will:

1. **Generate safe AI code** - Proper error handling, rate limiting
2. **Use streaming** - Better UX for text generation
3. **Add attribution** - "Generated by AI" disclaimers
4. **Respect privacy** - Consent dialogs for data sharing

## Customization

Edit `.agents-project.json` to disable specific rules:

```json
{
  "rules": {
    "exclude": ["gemini"]  // Disable if removing AI features
  }
}
```
